summary: This bill, the "Nationally Enhancing the Well-being of Babies through Outreach and Research Now Act" (NEWBORN Act), authorizes funding for infant mortality pilot programs in areas with high infant mortality rates. These programs will be overseen by the Secretary of Health and Human Services and will focus on addressing issues like birth defects, preterm birth, and maternal complications. Eligible entities, including health departments, can apply for grants to implement these programs, which can include outreach, service improvements, and public education. The bill also specifies funding authorization for these programs.
